4$Condition: Other$5/23/2019 2:38:19 PM$Reviewer: Cic, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$This is the worst medicine ever. I took it for postpartum anxiety  and it turned my anxiety into severe depression which I have never experienced in my life. When I took it I became insomniac, suicidal ideation, feeling deep unworthiness, wanting to leave my family, could barely walk, heart palpitation, nausea, weak memory. At some point, I became so numb and I felt so aggressive which I have never felt before in my life. I took it for 2 months and a half. I was taking 10 mg at a time. Withdrawal symptoms: non stop crying for no reason and ideation. now I am on week 4 fsince I stopped it and the withdrawal symptoms are still horrible. The ideation disappeared but the uncontrollable crying spells, coughing, insomnia are still there. sometimes I really feel like I lost my mind. This is again the worst thing that ever happened to me in my life. It is poison.

8$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$11/16/2018 3:51:26 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$4$Works for GAD and SAD with depression. I take it at night, I couldn't tolerate it in the morning b/c it gave me more anxiety in the am but at night totally different. I take it with Remeron a good combo. Side effects extremely low libido, but last longer in bed. Remeron makes me tired, paxil doesn't. 40 mg paxil 30 mg Remeron. w/o these meds my anxiety is so extreme i couldn't do much, just going in a gas station was hard. no medicine will make me like before i got anxiety, but quality of life is improved to resemblance of normality. Also I tried Viibryd it worked for depression but not my anxiety enough. no sexual side effects on that stuff, i recommend it for depression only. getting on it was a pain just like any other i suppose, it's too expensive anyway and not good enough for anxiety imo.
9$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$4/29/2018 1:59:40 PM$Reviewer: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on Paxil for more than 10 years after suffering episodes of anxiety/panic which would go on for months and leave me exhausted and depressed.  I started low (10mg) and felt results immediately.  I was able to sleep and stopped having fearful thoughts.  Eventually, I went to 5mg and stayed there for years.  It seems like it wouldn't work at this dosage, but my doctor recently put me on Zoloft to reduce risk of dizziness and I again started having high anxiety and sleeplessness.  Paxil seems to put a cap on the level of panic that my body can produce.  If you are experiencing a lot of side effects (I have few or none) see if your doctor will approve a lower dose.  This drug has given me great relief!

column1: 36$Condition: Depression$1/21/2015 4:46:04 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$5$"I had been depressed on and off since my childhood. This medication has worked very well to minimize my depression.  I began taking 20 mg. 19 years ago.  For the first 2 weeks I was tired and a little bit dizzy but I started to feel less depressed.  After about 2 months on this medication I was feeling much better and my doctor recommended that I remain on the medication.  Over the years it has taken larger doses to keep my depression at bay and I am currently taking 60 mg. per day with good results.  I have tried to wean myself off the medication on two different occasions over the years.  Within 2 - 3 days after reducing my dosage my ability to ""think"" went downhill very fast and I felt very confused.  I resumed taking the medication immediately on both occasions and my cognitive functions returned to normal in 1-2 weeks.  I will not try to wean myself off the meds again and will probably be on them forever.  A very fair trade-off for the good quality of life that I and my family have had for the past 19 years. "

column3: like a weight lifted from my back. I have not experienced weight gain
column4: in fact I have lost my appetite. No sexual side effects. I feel more peaceful. I am not worried about the ""what if's"" in life  which I worried about constantly.  My situation at home has not changed but now I am better able to cope with it. It scares me to read all the horror stories of  withdrawal but for right now
column5: I obviously need the relief I got form Paxil and will ask my doc for help when I don't need it any more. A little nausea and a headache for a few days is worth it to me to be able to sleep and stop worrying all day and night.  "

column1: 60$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$4/19/2014 8:48:07 PM$Reviewer: happypancake
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"Prescribed for Anxiety and Depression.  I have been taking Paxil for close to one year. Started with 20 mg
column3: then bumped up to 40 mg.  I have taken many other meds with overwhelming side effects and little to no reduction in anxiety. Paxil is the only med I've taken that has reduced both my anxiety and depression.

column1: I took Xanax (.25) PRN as I adjusted to Paxil
column2: and I no longer need it.  I read a LOT prior to and while I was weaning onto it
column3: and I was very nervous about side effects.  In an effort to deal with the ""sleepiness"" factory
column4: I took it at night
column5: and it made it much easier to fall and stay asleep.  Prior to Paxil
column6: I was taking melatonin to assist with sleeping
column7: but I would wake up in the middle of the night with anxiety that would keep me up.  I have had some reduction in libido
column8: but that has minimized as my body adjusted to the drug.

column1: Overall
column2: I am thrilled with my results.  My quality of life has drastically improved.  I am now able to work on my anxiety in public situations without the massive panic or anxiety attacks that would lead me to avoid or leave early from social engagements.

column1: My friends and significant other has noticed the difference
column2: and I cannot imagine my life without it.   Remember
column3: every one's body chemistry is different
column4: and my results may not be your experience.  Don't give up on happiness!"

column1: The absolute worst part of this is weaning off of the drug. I would miss doses from time to time and just be sick in withdrawal for a couple of days. Even when I was tapering it was hell. I wouldn't recommend this because of the difficulty of getting off of it."
63$Condition: Panic Disorder$3/31/2014 6:57:39 PM$Reviewer: Happy1978
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$This medication has changed my life. I spent me late high school years and college years self-medicating with recreational drugs and in a mental haze. I began Paxil when I was in college and felt immediate relief. The panic attacks abated and I could think clearly finally. I stopped taking Paxil in my mid-20's because I hated the shrink I was going to. HUGE mistake. Never stop this medication cold-turkey. It's hell. However
column3: I again started taking it a few years later and have been on it ever since. I now have a career
column4: a house
column5: etc. and I don't think I would be here if not for this medication. I understand that is causes problems in some people
column6: but for me it is truly miraculous. I previously suffered from depression
column7: social anxiety disorder and panic attacks. All of which were severe. I am now a happy person with ambition and am completely comfortable. I will be on this for life. There is a biological serotonin deficiency that runs in my family and I am glad to have treatment that was unavailable to my ancestors (for lack of a better word). I understand that some of the side effects of this drug can be bad
column8: but I credit it with saving my life. I am on a 30mg per day dosage. I tried to go down to 20
column9: but it was not working. Back up to 30 and all good. Again
column10: DO NOT stop taking Paxil cold turkey. You WILL get serotonin syndrome and it will NOT be fun. But as long as you keep up
column11: you'll be fine. I can absolutely tell when I've forgotten to take a daily dose
column12: but it's not as terrible as long-term withdraw.

80$Condition: Major Depressive Disorder$11/29/2013 1:40:57 AM$Reviewer: azure52, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$4$I started taking this medication in June/July of 2005. For over a year I had been having a major depressive episode with extreme bouts of anxiety & agoraphobia. I initially started taking Paxil QD along with a benzo TID until it ""kicked in"" & I no longer needed the benzo. I went from basically living in one room (at a relative's house) to one morning (in August) I woke up
column2: decided I wanted to be a nurse
column3: went to where I graduated college
column4: enrolled & registered for the term & started classes the next week. There is no way I can describe the change. From being terrified to go to the store & unable to go to a job interview to looking forward to going to classes & actually meeting & becoming friends with some classmates. Then I moved back into my own house
column5: started dating
column6: got engaged
column7: graduated nursing school
column8: got married
column9: got a job (RN in the ER) & had two kids. I have had approximately 6 what I call ""breakdowns"" in my life. I have been on about every anti-depressant in the book. They seemed to occur every 2-4 years. It has been over 8 years now since I have been on Paxil with nothing close to a breakdown. I do things I never thought I could do (because of anxiety
column10: social anxiety
column11: depression
column12: etc). I have premenstrual dysphoric disorder & it doesn't help at all with that (but that is not why I started taking it). Occasionally when under a great deal of external stressors I have small dips of depression or a bit of breakthrough anxiety. However nothing to the extent of before & it only lasts a few days at most. I am grateful for this medication
column13: I had been hesitant to take it for years because of all the scary things I read about it online. None of that was true & minimal side effects for me. At first I was a bit more tired
column14: that went away in a month. Just hoping this SSRI does not ""poop out"" on me the way Luvox did (my 2nd favorite depression/anxiety med). Last thing
column15: overall it definitely has decreased my sex drive although not my satisfaction."

column3: I was on lowest dosage & could not lower it anymore without  problems. column4: it was very touchy tapering off of Paxil & starting Wellbutrin.  My dr tried to take me off it too quickly & I felt completely out of my mind with anxiety. column5: EVER felt the horrible withdrawal symptoms like this!!  Be very cautious.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $3$3$3$"Do not take this drug if you ever plan to go off of it.  I took it for over 10 years and gradually went off of it (6) months ago.  My life has been a living hell since going off.  The withdrawal is so very bad.  I began having frontal brain ""episodes"" which feel like terribly frightening seizures - adrenaline surges that can not be described.  This withdrawal has taken over my work/home/social life.  Utter anxiety / depression / panic and fear all of the time.  I spoke to a pharmacist / chemist who called my symptoms ""seratonin storm"" - he also told me that the way I described it as my brain suddenly being pumped full of adrenaline is a perfect description.  It is adrenaline. When it happens (with no warning at all) it feels like I have lost absolute total control of my thinking / body / brain and I go into a total panic.  This is a terrible drug.  Don't go on it.  The withdrawal is a hell I wouldn't wish on anyone.  It is not worth it at all.  Doctors don't know about this hell
column3: they just don't.  They haven't been told about this
column4: of course the drug companies wouldn't tell them about it.  They want to be ""the drug of choice.""

column1: Once again - do not start this drug.  Don't do it - tell everyone about the hell of going off of Paxil - or Paroxatene CR."

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$1$2$Started on 10mgs. Within 2 weeks I was 100% depression/anxiety free. Fast forward 18 months I quit going to work had lost all inhibitions
column3: felt happier than ever but I just wanted to drink alcohol and sleep. Spoke with the Dr. he wanted to up the dose of Paxil

It started when i forgot to take the med for about a week and started having really bad withdrawls which included horrible nightmares! it got to the point that my boyfriend spent the night almost every night because i would wake up in a panic and not know where i was or if the dream was real or not. after i started taking the medicine again i started not being able to sleep all night. i would still wake up in panics numerous times every night not knowing where i was to the point that i was scared to even fall asleep! i took 20mg of ambien 2 nights in a row and i slept a total of about 24 hours! I have also had no modivation or energy to do anything the past couple months which is affecting my relationship with my boyfriend and my job. I am going to the doctor soon too see if i can get off of paxil or get some more ambien or another strong sleep med so i can actually sleep!!

column1: 144$Condition: Other$7/15/2012 4:22:57 PM$Reviewer: skeet
column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver) $3$1$5$My mom was put on Paxil about 8 years ago. She told me it was to help with her low blood sugar issues and help her sleep better. Side effects she has experienced include inattentiveness
column3: digestive issues
column4: urinary problems
column5: coughing
column6: bruising
column7: and worst of all significant memory loss. She is now in assisted living because of her memory issues. Sadly
column8: she has not been able to get oof of the drug because of terrible withdrawal symptoms - not sleeping at all
column9: confusion
column10: no desire to eat being the worst. The first time she went from 10mg/day to 5 mg/day for 2 weeks. Then 5 mg every other day for about a month
column11: then she stopped. Due to the withdrawal
column12: she went back to her original dose of 20mg. Since then I've learned that because of the way Paxil works
column13: the every other day regimine should not be used. The second time she went from 20mg to 15mg for about 6 weeks. Then 15 mg to 10 for another 6 weeks or so. She did OK. But when she went from 10mg to 5 mg it was a repeat of the withdrawal she had the first time. The more searching I do the more I see how difficult it is for people to get off of Paxil. People considering taking Paxil really need to research the side effects (make sure you are seeing the complete list as I didn't know the coughing and bruising were sideaffects until this week) and the problems with withdrawal before making their decision. Consider whether the risks are worth it. My mom would say no.

column1:
185$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$10/25/2011 3:36:07 AM$Reviewer: pandabear, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$My doctor put me on Paxil for the first time about 3 months ago for frequent anxiety attacks, panic, and mild depression. The first few days of Paxil, i felt a little tired and hazy but also had a slight euphoric feeling.  After about 2 weeks my anxiety totally dissappeared! This was truly a lifesaver because i was having almost 10 attacks a day (mostly at night.)I couldnt even get a full breath before Paxil and now am breathing normally. The only negative side effect i can list is that my sex drive has gone down but I was on overdrive before Paxil so , in my case, I dont mind it .This medication also got rid of my daily headaches, and little aches and pains( probably associated with the depression.) I used to take ibuprofen everyday and now I might take it once or twice a month for an occasional headache.  I have heard of other people gaining weight on this drug but I actually lost 12 pounds since I have been on it.  I have noticed my appetite has slighly decreased. Overall, I would highly recommend this drug for panic /anxiety .  Also, my grandmother started using Paxil 10 years ago and is still on it and claims she cant live without it.

190$Condition: Extreme Apprehension or Fear of Social Interaction$9/5/2011 7:43:03 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have had severe panic disorder since I was 10 yrs old.I barely managed my adult life,I married at age 16 first child by age 17, I was never able to hold down a job due to the overwhelming panic,I had 4 children within a 7 year period, I stayed married to an evil man for 32 years, the marriage was a living hell,but I could not find the courage to get out,I was put on paxil 11 years ago,if I could go back in time,I wish I had discovered this medication much earlier, I would never have stayed in the abusive marriage,I would have gotten myself and my kids out, and found happiness and a career.My panic attacks are so bad that even with the 40mg I need another med to stay level. I now the ability to have a happy stable life.I found the courage to get out of a horrible marriage.My life is so much better,I have found happiness. I am getting older near 60 now I want to decrese my dossage but  the withdrawal symptoms are horrible, I think the only way I can come off paxil I will need to be hospitalized. Paxil gave me a life and I do not regret being put on this med, each person has to make their own decisions about their mental health.I do suggest that you see a Phyciatrist MD and do notlet your family doctor try to handle your mental problems. Mental health is a medical problem and someday will be recognized as a medical condition. Don't ever give up!

column3: severe panic attacks and moderate social anxiety disorder. I also have bipolar depression. I started on 10mg and got no result but then increased to 20mg and it worked wonders. I am naturally a disorganized and lazy person and this drug pretty much took away any motivation I had. I use to be a slim 105lbs and while on this I jumped up to 130lb and stayed there. Also the withdrawl symptoms were the worst. If i missed even one dose I would get very dizzy
column4: my brain would start ""zapping"" if that makes sense and I would feel physically sick and exhausted. When I stopped taking this medicine I was weened off slowly and still had very bad withdrawl symptoms. I would cry for no apparent reason and I ended up quitting my job because I was just so depressed during this time that I could barely get myself out of bed. I would recommend it if you simply have anxiety but I think you have to be very careful when taking this drug. I can understand why the suicide rate is higher than other SSRI's when coming off this medicine.  "

229$Condition: Panic Disorder$2/20/2011 9:44:07 PM$Reviewer: RPL, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$There are a lot of horror stories about this medicine. You are not supposed to quite cold turkey! Paxil gave me my life back and even if I do have problems when I decide to go off they would be nowhere near the hell I was in. Paxil delivered me from the most violent of emotions, severe panic, irritability, depression, fear, obsession, etc. The last seven years of my life have been wonderful and I owe it to this drug. If nothing else, it saved me from insanity or even death. I don't think my body could have handled what was happening to it for much longer. Yeah, I experience difficult side effects when i forget a dose but I can deal with it and if i ever do decide to go off i will do so be weaning myself off it over a period of months like it is supposed to be done. when it's done this way, it is much easier. ask yourself one question when considering paxil?, can anything be worse than what you're going through now. maybe, just maybe, it will do for you what it did for me. i wish you well.

I would just fall asleep, and my family would have trouble waking me up.  Also, my blood became very thin.  I scratched a bug bite on my leg, and within seconds blood had run down my leg onto the floor.
247$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/5/2011 10:24:14 AM$Reviewer: breezee,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$4$DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG. I itch all the time, my stomach hurts, my feet are dry and peeling and cracked. I gained 42 pounds starting the drug. Didn't matter how little I ate, I still gained. I'm very irritable and hostile. This drug is in the top 3 most dangerous antidepressants. DO NOT USE.
248$Condition: Panic Disorder$12/30/2010 5:30:59 PM$Reviewer: NS2935, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$2005, age 55, had my first panic attack and started taking Paxil generic (paroxetine) 10mg, 20mg, 30mg and 40mg and now take a 20mg once daily.  Jan 2010 decided to wean off by taking 10mg once daily.  April 2010 reduced to 5mg once daily.  May 2010 stopped the Paxil.  Life seemed great until a family crisis, shortly almost lost our pet of eleven years and dear friend and neighbor died suddenly.  I had to start back on the Paxil 10mg and in two weeks increased to 20mg daily.  The anxiety brings on such a bad physical problems like tension around my chest on the left side and the tension around the heart is scary.  Guess once you’re diagnosed and placed on antidepressant's like Paxil it is a lifetime maintenance drug.  I had no side effects in going off the Paxil as stated by other reviewers.  But, I did wean myself off the Paxil very slowly over the next 4 to 5 months from 20 to 10 to 5mg.  Nobody should quit cold turkey.  As a male at age 55 to 60, I did find it annoying to loose libido and climaxing is very difficult while on Paxil.  This was part of the main driver to get off the Paxil was to enjoy what sex life is left for me.  If you have IBS problems this medication can really help.  The higher the dosage however can constipate you and makes bowel movements very harsh from bulking up.

column1: 251$Condition: Depression$12/11/2010 2:28:28 PM$Reviewer: JW
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"I have been on Paxil for about 2 years now. I spent years in therapy with limited results. Paxil eliminated my depression in 2 weeks! Absolutely amazing!

column1: There are side effects: a slight loss in libido. Not much though... I just care slightly less about sex.
Weight gain. Yes this is absolutely true. At first I gained about 10 pounds and I think this is common.

I got rid of the weight this year by running. Admittedly I run 5-6 miles 3-4 times a week but that did the trick. I would highly recommend if you go on paxil you start a regular schedule of running. Combined it is excellent!"

column1: 253$Condition: Panic Disorder$12/3/2010 6:35:03 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$4$4$I have been on Paroxetine (general Paxil) since I was twelve years of age. I suffer from a rather severe case of panic disorder that had practically become agoraphobia. (I refused to leave the house.) Paxil gives me the ability to separate obsessive and damaging thoughts from rational ones. I was taken off of Paxil and put on Prozac for a while
column2: the Prozac made me feel CRAZY. Wellbutrin did nothing. After I was put back on Paxil
column3: I felt like I was myself again. I have suffered some weight gain and I am thirsty more often than most people
column4: but I have the ability to think clearly! I still have the occasional panic attack
column5: but I understand what's happening and I'm able to think myself through it. Paxil is NOT for everyone
column6: but it's definitely been the best fix for me. I hope to one day decrease my dose gradually and get off of it
column7: but in due time.

column1: 254$Condition: Panic Disorder$11/25/2010 8:17:30 PM$Reviewer: Layla

column3: but not enough to make me stop taking it.

column1: 255$Condition: Obsessive Compulsive Disorder$11/23/2010 12:30:27 PM$Reviewer: No More
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$3$5$I have been on Paxil for 4 years. It has helped with my OCD
column3: boosted confidence
column4: erased panic attacks and reduced my anxiety and irritability. After 4 years however I would like to go off of this medication. I feel like I've been living in a perfect little bubble. I don't feel sad anymore but I also don't feel happy either. Paxil makes you numb. I don't want to go through life numb anymore. In four years I've gained around 50 pounds. I've recently just stopped taking Paxil and did a body cleanse to help get the chemicals out of my body. For three weeks I was irritable
column5: dizzy
column6: itchy and developed a crazy rash around my neck and face. I thought I was going crazy and needed to be on Paxil. If this is life without Paxil then I guess I just need to be on it! I talked to my doctor and she never mentioned that those were the side effects of detoxing off of it. She just quickly filled my prescription again. Now that I know the side effects I'm going to quit. It is going to suck but I'm going to hang in there and stick it out. I don't want Paxil to run my life.

column1: 256$Condition: Depression$11/8/2010 9:47:06 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$4$5$If a dose is missed for one to two day

column1: 257$Condition: Repeated Episodes of Anxiety$11/6/2010 2:21:45 AM$Reviewer: kimmer40
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been taking Paxil for about 9 years and have had almost no side effects. It has worked wonderfully for my GAD (Generalized Anxiety Disorder). I did stop taking it for about a year. As with many medications for anxiety or depression
column3: you cannot stop taking it all at once. I started taking one every other day for about a month and then every 2 days for a couple of weeks and so on until I didn't need it.  A series of stressful events caused my anxiety to return and I resumed taking Paxil with no problems. My doctor indicated that Paxil should be taken in the morning. It is important to take it everyday to keep the levels in your body even. If I have to take it the rest of life
column4: that would be ok with me.

261$Condition: Panic Disorder$10/15/2010 3:44:09 AM$Reviewer: sixthlabyrinth, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$2$I began taking Paxil when I was eighteen years old. My freshman year of college I developed severe Panic & Generalized Anxiety Disorder
column2: and would have nightmarish panic attacks daily. I was in complete anguish
column3: it felt like every moment of my life was an uncomfortable and unbearable minute that I just wanted to be over. I was first prescribed xanax
column4: but as I needed to take xanax daily to help with my panic
column5: my physician switched me to paxil combined with therapy.

column1: I immediately noticed a difference - I began to feel  sane again! Despite my long use of xanax
column2: it was no longer necessary on paxil. I was on Paxil for ten months
column3: and about three months in was on a daily high dosage of 75mg. Although I felt sane and safe again
column4: there were a couple side effects I noticed: ZERO and I mean ZERO sex drive; a somewhat Zombie like existence - I felt removed from any sort of strong emotion and would find my self often quite zonked out; occasional confusion
column5: often a part of the ""zombie"" experience; either complete exhaustion or total insomnia; and
column6: finally
column7: a somewhat alarming weight loss. I was already thin - 5'6"" and 115lbs - and found myself
column8: at one point
column9: weighing a frightening 106lbs. I just never felt hungry
column10: already had a slightly irregular schedule
column11: and would literally finding myself just forgetting to eat.

column1: However
column2: the benefits outweighed the negatives in my opinion. I never thought I could be panic free. After 10 months I went off it cold turkey and had the most bizarre experiences (although
column3: unlike most reviews
column4: I didn't find it extremely unpleasant): I experienced tingling all over my body
column5: vivid (but not frightening) dreams
column6: extremely heightened sexual arousal
column7: and a general feeling of weightlessness. I literally felt like I was being born again.

column1: 2 years after I went off Paxil
column2: due to daily&emotional stresses
column3: I began having panic attacks again. I have now been back on it for 1 month. I know it's a powerful drug
column4: but I can honestly say Paxil has saved my life."

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I have been taking Paxil for about 7 years. It worked miracles for me
column3: when I didn't think anything would help with my depression. Although my family refers to them as my crazy pills
column4: I have to agree. A couple years ago I missed 5days of meds
column5: out of laziness. Late in the 5th day i noticed numbing hands
column6: and I went into a state of total confusion. I didn't know my children's
column7: fiances
column8: or dogs names. 10 seconds after taking meds I was fine. Very scary
column9: though. Don't ever try to quit cold turkey. God only knows what would have happened if I was alone that day. Yesterday morning I woke up
column10: took my meds with a sip of coffee then went out to sit and do my crossword puzzle. As I looked at my paper
column11: nothing made sense(simple clues and words). I recognized that same confused state as when I experienced withdrawls. I couldn't remember what a pool was called
column12: and I couldn't speak the names of my dogs
column13: kids and fiance again. Noone was with me
column14: so I just sat and kept trying my crossword puzzle over and over. finally
column15: after about 15 mins. I was fine-even scarier this time because I hadn't missed any meds. I went to the doctor and was told it could have been a mini stroke-a side effect of Paxil. I am having an MRI and blood work today. Hopefully it isn't related to Paxil and it's nothing. Paxil has literally been a life-saver for me.

column1: 286$Condition: Posttraumatic Stress Syndrome$7/19/2010 9:53:47 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$4$5$I was prescribed a different medication which made my anxiety much worse. column2: I am now trying to wean off of Paxil due to a weight gain of 35 pounds and zero Libido.  My weaning process (day 7) has not been as traumatic as others have reported.  Maybe because my dosage is only 10 mg.  I have had a few symptoms such as extremely lethargy
column3: dizziness
column4: ringing in my ears
column5: and crying bursts.  I am handling it.  I hope to be fully rid of Paxil for life.  Not because of its effectiveness because I felt very good on it but I am on other medications for other reasons (not anxiety) and don't believe in taking a lot of medications.  Eventually medications don't work well with each other
column6: then they're black boxed for other reasons.  Sometimes it is a mess.  I am going through Menopause and truly believe that it is a cause for a lot of my medical problems including anxiety.  Since the start of perimenopause and now in full blown menopause I have been diagnosed with several problems medically and now PSS.  We will see
column7: I might be back on Paxil for life.  It is what it is.  Do what makes you feel right and not what others tell you what to do.  Just be informed!  Try to enjoy life.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $3$3$5$I've been on Paxil several times. Recently I went on Paxil again - my business has been greatly effected by the economic difficulties.  This time the side effects are a real problem.  In summary they include being constantly very tired
column3: muscle weekness and major sleeping pattern disruption.  Some days it's near impossible to stay awake and I may sleep at night or be tired and not be able to fall asleep.  No sexual desire at all and a very low energy level.  I'm thinking I'll start weaning myself off the medication slowly.  I tried to go cold turkey and after a few days started getting the shakes.  From my reading I've gleaned that people may respond very differently to this medication and that even the same individual may have different reactions at different time.  I have pretty bad allergies and during allergy season the tiredness and weakness increases.

column1: It has been a wonder drug in terms of helping me with social anxiety.   It has been less effective in dealing with my  general anxiety disorder.   I still have been very anxious.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on Paxil for 15 years. I have also been on it while pregnant with one child and breastfed 2 children while on it. Both children are healthy and have suffered no ill effects from it(they are middle school age and younger).  I started taking it for depression/anxiety/panic and within 3 days I reported to my psychiatrist that the cloud had lifted. I went off it with my first child and struggled throughout the pregnancy so it was advised I stay on it through the next pregnancy. I have also tried to switch to other meds but have always gone back to Paxil.  The side effects of the withdrawal each time were always horrible. I have decided to just stay on it forever because I am happy on it. I had a lot of side effects when I started Paxil for the first several months to year but they were much better than crying constantly. I have struggled with depression/anxiety/panic all of my life.  I don't have any memory of not having it or not feeling it lurking.  The Paxil gave me my life.  BTW
column3: I did have therapy in the beginning when I started the med. I think it helps the effectiveness ultimately.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$"I was put on Paxil in Jan 2008. By July 2008 I had lost everything we worked so hard to come by. I felt wonderfull on this drug and had not a care in the world. I left my family

column4: which by the way is not a good idea
column5: I have never felt worse in my life. My depression is off the charts
column6: I have lost intrest in anything I was ever interested in (including my kids)and have been within inches of hanging myself after researching the proper way to tie a noose. It has been hell since I quit the drug in Aug2008. I have never felt like even my old self and it is wrecking my household.

column1: I can not say you will have the same results but make sure you are checked for bi-polar (manic depressive) before you start. Also it is wise not to like recreational drugs or alcohol
column2: they will tell you that a little is ok but this is a bad mix no matter what
column3: I havent been in so many fights since high school not to mention the total disregard for laws that keep everyone else safe i.e. finding your car on the lawn. I blame evrything on that drug thou I know they were my actions that resulted in my hardships

column5: I have read stories alike. Make sure your primary care doc cares enough about you and not the med kick back. I had researched before I met with mine and ""asked my doctor"" like they say in the ads and she said my insurance would only cover two different options. I have Blue care network

column8: she gave me samples first. I now live this way without seeking proper medical treatment due to my developed distrust of the medical field."

column1: 362$Condition: Depression$12/9/2009 11:11:56 AM$Reviewer: bonnieln578
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$5$5$I began taking Paxil in March 2004 after becoming so depressed that I could barely get out of bed in the morning.  I took it successfull for 3 years.  I felt so much better within weeks of beginning the medication.  My doctor and I decided that after 3 years
column3: I was well enough to do without it.  However
column4: withdrawal is not easy!  You must do it very gradually.  I tried to quit cold turkey
column5: and I can't begin to tell you how bad it was.  I felt like my brain was receiving an 'electrical jolt' every 10 minutes or so.  I was so dizzy when getting up from a chair or out of bed
column6: that I had to resume the med for another few weeks and then try again.  This time
column7: it was a very gradual withdrawal.  I took the Paxil for 7 days
column8: then skipped a day
column9: then for 6 days
column10: and skipped a day
column11: and so on.  When I was down to every 3 days
column12: I took it that way for a few weeks
column13: then every 2 days for a while
column14: then every other day.  Gradually I began stretching the days without it
column15: until finally I successfully weaned myself off it.  Today I am well
column16: and I'm glad this drug was available for me.  However
column17: for anyone trying to quit Paxil
column18: do so very gradually.  Cold turkey is absolutely not an option!

column1: 378$Condition: Depression$10/30/2009 12:51:49 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $3$2$4$"         BEWARE OF WITHDRAWLS!!!!

I am 33 and have been on paxil since 1998.  Paxil has kept me even emotionally. Recently I decided to quit paxil and try out something else. The main factor in the switch is that I basically have had NO sex drive for years.  I was worried about the withdrawl side effects so i asked my doctor about them. She proceeded to tell me there were none.  TOTAL LIE.  The withdrawls are scary and I did not realize this until I started reading boards.  I have experienced severe dizziness
column2: loss of balance

column4: and severe heart skips that zaps my whole body. I feel all round weird.  I have been completely off for 10 days without any decrease in symptoms.  I was taken off cold turkey.  I voiced my concerns about reducing doses but was told that there are no side effects LIE. BE CAREFUL and slowly ween off Paxil.  By the way my sexual desire has returned and has saved my relationship!!!"

column4: a few yr's then 40mg/day then 60mg/day for past 2.5 yr's. It quit working over the past few mo's. I'm weaning off it and replacing w/ 150mg Effexor. Process is very hard but much preferred to its not working of late. Sweats
column5: jitters
column6: no focus--can't even complete a thought/sentence.  W/out the med's though
column7: I'd have been an even bigger mess!  Could not hold a job nor earn a living but now I'm more optimistic than ever.  Go get help and rule nothing out: EMDR took a while for its affects to kick in but it's a work in progress
column8: as is life.  "

column5: couldnt think

I am a medical asst-so I realized there was a problem and called my dr. He said we needed to stop the Paxil. Day 1 of stopping
column12: I was so HAPPY. It was such a change and I loved it
column13: alot of short term memory problems that day

column17: got the new meds and went home. I couldnt remember if I could take Xanax yet or had to wait. I called the dr I work for
column18: he was aware of all of my issues. He told me that what I was going through were very extreme reactions and to take the Xanax
column19: all would be ok. I took it while I was on the phone so I wouldnt forget. I am on day 4 of no Paxil
column23: but I will get passed this. I never felt like I was going to physically hurt myself or others. Medicine is not an exact science
column24: its individual. This is not a medication for me

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I previously posted here about my experience with Paxil. I was prescribed Paxil for Generalized Anxiety Disorder. I have now been on Paxil for about 5 weeks and I am doing fantastic! My dosing went as follows:

column1: weeks 1-2 10 mg
weeks 2-4 20 mg
Week 5 30 mg
I started the 30mg yesterday and slept even better! I am almost anxiety free! I have lost a total of 11 pounds
column2: my depression has lifted
column3: and I no longer have morbid thoughts/daydreams.

column1: The only side effects I have are my frequency in urination has changed (I pee more)
column2: drowsiness (I take paxil at 6pm everynight)
column3: and it's harder to achieve an orgasm
column4: but with some creativity it still happens. My sex drive itself has not been affected at all.

column1: Overall I give Paxil 5 stars. I LOVE Paxil. I have had such a great experience with Paxil. I am finished having children and do not plan on any more pregnancies (I have an IUD)
column2: so I plan to stay on Paxil as long as needed. Paxil has saved my sanity!"

column1: 507$Condition: Panic Disorder$1/7/2009 4:09:36 PM$Reviewer: TLRI
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$2$4$I took Paxil for 8 years. I'm 25 now. I DO NOT really recommend this med. Yes it works to help Panic attacks and depression. But if you EVER wanna have kids or get pregnant and still take this med. Your baby WILL come out with problems. Check out youtube. Paxil babies. This is the reason I got off Paxil. I didnt wanna have a messed up baby. Also another thing. To get off this med is one hard thing to do. It took me 5 1/2 months to get off of. (tapering) I was shaking and it felt like my eyes and head was jolting. Bright lights hurt. I felt sick to my tummy and had weird heart beats. All the side effects are gone now. As for my panic attacks and depression. Its mind over matter. PERIOD. If your gonna think sick ur gonna be sick. Try using breathing exercises
column3: keep calm and dont let things bother you. Think about happy things. Also if you have people in your life who bring you down then hey that may be your issue. I been off paxil since 2007 and feel great I no longer sleep 14-15 hours.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$5$5$"My doctor started me on Paxil 20mg a little over two weeks ago for Generalized Anxiety D/O and Depression. After a few days of feeling ""zombie like"" I talked to a nurse practitioner at work (I work in mental health)and she suggested I cut down to 10mg for the month until I see my doctor again.  This medication has changed my life! Within one week I started noticing a huge difference in the amount of anxiety attacks
column3: irrational thoughts
column4: and depression. Before starting this med
column5: I was a monster. Always irritable
column6: anxious
column7: worrisome
column8: and frankly
column9: I was a total bitch! I yelled at my kids for no reason (and husband) and flew off the handle at the smallest thing! I had pervasive thoughts of morbid things happening to me or my kids
column10: and always worried about their safety. My irrational thoughts and anxiety consumed me to the point I could not focus on my job or home life.

column1: Since starting Paxil I have been so happy! Within 10 days my husband noticed a huge difference and told me he loves the new me! I am no longer anxious
column2: grumpy
column3: or depressed. I am finally sleeping for the first time in a long time.

column4: and it takes longer have an orgasm than it did before. It does make me very sleepy so I take it at bedtime (well after dinner
column5: usually between 6 and 7 pm)
column6: and I notice I am still a little groggy the next day
column7: but I will take a little grogginess any day over anxiety and depression.

column1: Overall I am very satisfied with Paxil. I KNOW the withdrawal side effects are pretty bad (I have been warned)
column2: but at this point in my life I am just trying to focus on daily events
column3: my career
column4: and my family. I don't think i'll be going off this med anytime soon
column5: so I am not going to worry about withdrawal right now.

column1: I am currently on 10mg of Paxil and not quiet sure if I will need 20mg! So far so good with the 10mg

I believe if I had been on Paxil during this career change I would have dealt with it ok since I changed jobs before while on it and was fi.  But I have again fallen into the deep pits and see no way out.  Went to Dr. to get prescription for anxiety/depression other than paxil in case I need to stay on med if I get pregnant.  Was prescribed Celexa and its only day 3 but I feel horrible- more anxious
column9: not feeling happy yet (but again only day 3)cant get more than 5 hrs sleep

column7: and it caused me feelings of depression and anxiety for years.  I would read self-help books having to do with coping with anxiety and discovering my true self
column8: but nothing worked all that well
column9: until I told my doctor about my anxiety and she suggested I try Paxil.  I got on it
column10: and the drug has completely changed my life!  I no longer have any panic attacks; I have quit my dead-end job that I worked at for 15 years just because I thought I couldn't do anything else
column11: and am now a sales representative with my own home-based business; I am a better mother to my four children; I no longer have a sick feeling in my stomach so much of the time like I used to have (in fact
column12: I don't ever have that sick feeling at all anymore!).  The only drawback I may see to this is the fact that I have not experienced this self-confidence ever in my life before this
column13: so sometimes I get a little carried away in social situations
column14: and maybe say too much or act a little wilder than a lot of the other people.  I now do not worry about anything
column15: and I have a general feeling that everything will be fine in life.  I have gone from one extreme to the other with dealing with stress
column16: and I definitely like this extreme a lot better!

column5: weight gain
column6: and I simply didn't want to be on an anti-depressant.  The withdrawl side effects are HORRIBLE
column7: and last for DAYS!!!!!  I cannot believe this is a legal drug.  I also cannot believe the ease of getting a RX for it.  My doctor literally asked ""what do you want to take/""  Thirty seconds later I had a script for poison.  When I started taking Paxil
column8: I was too young and nieve to research it.  I do remember the first 2 weeks of taking it
column9: my anxiety was MUCH worse
column10: I couldn't sleep
column11: and I would sweat profusely.  That was only 10mg!!  I would seriously think twice about ANY anti-depressant.  They all have terrible side/withdrawl side effects.  If you ever decide to quit the drug
column12: it will take you months to ween off properly.  I quit cold turkey- NOT ADVISED!!  It was literally the hardest experience I have been through.  I will never take a brain altering drug again!!  Look up anti-depressant withdrawl on the internet
column13: you will see the horror stories the Drs. don't tell you about."
